izzy.classification.confusion_matrix¶

izzy.classification.confusion_matrix(y_true, y_pred, sample_weights=None)[source]¶

Compute the confusion matrix

The confusion matrix is a 2D matrix that shows actual outcomes (as rows) and predicted outcomes (as columns). The matrix displays the counts of observations that fall into each bucket. From this, we can compute false negatives, false positives, true negatives, true positives, and other metrics derived from these.

Parameters

  • y_true (ArrayLike) – True outcomes

  • y_pred (ArrayLike) – Predicted outcomes, must already be classified

  • sample_weights (ArrayLike) – Weights associated with individual observations

Returns

Confusion matrix with classes as row and column labels

Return type

pandas.DataFrame
